bibl.title: Letter from J.A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, [19--?]

div1.p: LePrince writes to Carter about the ongoing anti-malaria work and a conference they attended. [enclosed: a note on the use of wave action to control mosquitoes]

div1.head: Letter from J.A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, [19--?]
div1.opener:
Mal,
LePrince
THE COMMITTEE ON ENGINEERING
OF THE
NATIONAL MALARIA COMMITTEE
HEADQUARTERS ROOM 17 COURTHOUSE
MEMPHIS, TENN.,
J. A. LE PRINCE, CHAIRMAN
B. H. MCGRORY
L. L. HIDINGER
H. W. VAN HOVENBERG
Dear Dr Carter
div1.p:
I have received your letter
re Deeks & Coogle and also the “proof” that I am
returning today-for his proceedings-

I appeared to get your “wireless” as I wrote
Dr Deeks refering him to Rudolphs
paper in the last proceedings of the N. J.
Mas. Ext Assn 1924 issue Eleventh Ann. Meeting - Rudolps made
some good observations on
"Influence of External Conditions on Behavior of
Mosquitoes- P58 to 64-.

In accordance with your suggestions I am
going to get Dr Deeks together with Dr Coogle & myself
so we can be alone and discuss what Coogle has
done so Deeks can yet practical lines of thought
and application- & question of main anopheles
involved, its habits, etc-

I understand Barber (and possibly Komp
also) is going on down to Tela & other Fruit to
plantations this winter for two months or more-

It seems to me best to have Dr Deeks
as the Chairman of the N. M. A for the next
time- It would pep things up a bit-
Im as busy as a bird day-

A modified copy of enclosed is
being published in Jour Am Pub Hassu
& comment will appear in “The American
City” N. Y. L- The In “Municipal & County
Engineering,” Indianapolis Ind- Also in a
Canadian Tech. Jour.- I refer to “What
the Eng. Can & Should Do etc”

Im arranging so our men will
write out their discussions of papers at
M. F. Workers Conference (in advance) & also have
brief of same - to save time & to make the
Proceedings better & of more use to others-

Tallassee Power Co, Ala Power Co, & others are
sending Delegates to Mal Field Workers Conference & Shelby County is
sending its mosquito field man, its age
dem. agent & Parent Teachers Assn member
who was chairman of Rural School Dist
that won 1st prize for rural anti malaria
improvement work of 13 competing rural
school districts-

21 different Sections of the county
more than 3 miles from city of Memphis
took up work this last g Summer
3
Mr Copp tells me he is arranging
for systematic publicity work,
to go into rural press of several
counties of N. C-.

He, His lawyers, Smith & Herndon?
were here Friday to take my deposition-.
An all day session-.

I hope you like the program-
It seems good to me except that
the V S P H S is plastered on too thick- but
I must be loyal & not criticize - the results
must be achieved in spite of the bumps.
Im a little afraid some of State Health
Dept will comment adversely - & my
opinion is our work & results achieved
is the best ad. we can have or desire-

I enclose a paper extractedtaken from
N. J. Conference referred to-

With best wishes to Miss Laura &
yourself
